result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher J. Hoch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
** 1 DAY CREDIT IF REVOKED**

If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher J. Hoch

records.addlTxt: Reminder Notice indicating amount due mailed to defendant.

Case called at 10:06 AM.
Defendant Christopher J. Hoch in court with Attorney Susan M Meade in court.  Prosecuting Attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Agreement has been reached. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 1 as charged. Sentence is Withheld and the Defendant is placed on 12 Months of Probation with the following conditions:
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. Court Costs/surcharges. Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. 
Defendant is granted 1 day of sentence credit.

Attorney Susan Meade at $100/hr.  Defendant shall reimburse Eau Claire County by making payments of $100 beginning 10/14/2022 and every 30 days thereafter.  Payment shall not exceed the full cost of representation.
CK 44270 mailed to defendant. Signature bond ordered; bail posted refunded.
